course_description: Initial lessons of a structured Danish course following the Pimsleur methodology

lessons.title: First Meetings
lessons.total_number_of_segments: use around 200 rows for the whole csv

introduction_conversation.description: short conversation entirely in danish containing all of the target phrases, use extra words if required to make the conversation make sense

teach_first_target_phrases.description: introduce the first few target phrases explain how to pronouce them, and what they mean, repeat each 2-3 times

first_practise.description: practise each of the target phrases with a combination of call and response, guided conversation and free practise, repeat each phrase 3-4 times with spacing

teach_remaining_phrases.description: introduce the first few target phrases explain how to pronouce them, and what they mean, repeat each 2-3 times

second_practise.description: practise remaining target phrases with a combination of call and response, guided conversation and free practise, repeat each phrase 3-4 times with spacing

review_and_summary.description: quick review of the target phrases short conversation entirely in danish using the target phrases, use extra words if required to make the conversation make sense

lines.danish: Ja. En, to, tre, fire, fem, seks, syv, otte, ni, ti.
lines.english: Yes. One, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten.

lines.danish: Jeg vil gerne have en kop kaffe
lines.english: I would like a cup of coffee
Excuse me, what time is it?

lines.danish: Det er koldt og det regner

lines.english: Excuse me, where is the supermarket?

lines.danish: Det er lige ud og til højre på hjørnet
lines.english: It's straight ahead and to the right on the corner

lines.danish: Ja, jeg har en søster og en bror
lines.english: Yes, I have a sister and a brother

lines.danish: Kan du tælle fra ti til tyve?
lines.english: Can you count from ten to twenty?

lines.danish: Jeg vil gerne have brød og mælk
lines.english: I would like bread and milk

target_phrases.english: Where does the bus go to?
I need to buy a ticket

lines.danish: Undskyld, hvor går denne bus til?
lines.english: Excuse me, where does this bus go to?

lines.danish: Har I denne trøje i blå?
lines.english: Do you have this sweater in blue?

lines.danish: Nej, kun i rød og sort
lines.english: No, only in red and black

introduction.description: Introduction to past tense with common verbs

lines.danish: Jeg spiste frokost med min ven
lines.english: I ate lunch with my friend
Excuse me, can you help me?
Yes, of course. What's the problem?

introduction.description: Vocabulary for common hobbies and interests

target_phrases.danish: Hvad laver du i din fritid?
target_phrases.english: What do you do in your free time?

lines.danish: Hvad laver du i din fritid?
lines.english: What do you do in your free time?

lines.danish: Jeg spiller fodbold og læser bøger
lines.english: I play football and read books

target_phrases.english: What are you going to do?

lines.danish: Hvad skal du lave i morgen?
lines.english: What are you going to do tomorrow?

lines.danish: Jeg skal mødes med mine venner
lines.english: I'm going to meet with my friends

target_phrases.danish: Jeg har brug for en læge

lines.danish: Har I denne trøje i medium?
lines.english: Do you have this shirt in medium?
Yes, would you like to try it on?
What would you like to order?

lines.danish: Jeg vil gerne have fiskesuppe, tak
lines.english: I would like the fish soup, please

recap_phrases.english: What are you going to do?

lines.danish: Skal vi lave noget i weekenden?
lines.english: Should we do something on the weekend?

lines.danish: Ja, vi kunne gå i biografen
lines.english: Yes, we could go to the cinema

lines.danish: Hvilken årstid kan du bedst lide?
lines.english: Which season do you like best?

lines.danish: Har du tid til et møde i dag?
lines.english: Do you have time for a meeting today?

lines.danish: Ja, jeg er ledig efter frokost

lines.english: What do you think about the movie?

lines.danish: Skal vi mødes og spise frokost på lørdag?
lines.english: Should we meet and have lunch on Saturday?

lines.danish: Det kommer an på vejret. Hvad med søndag i stedet for?
lines.english: It depends on the weather. How about Sunday instead?

lines.danish: Det passer mig fint. Vi kunne også gå en tur bagefter
lines.english: That suits me fine. We could also go for a walk afterwards

target_phrases.danish: Det lyder som en god idé
target_phrases.english: That sounds like a good idea

lines.danish: Skal vi tage på café eller restaurant på lørdag?
lines.english: Should we go to a café or restaurant on Saturday?

lines.danish: Hvad foretrækker du? Det er op til dig
lines.english: What do you prefer? It's up to you

lines.danish: Lad os gå på den nye italienske restaurant
lines.english: Let's go to the new Italian restaurant

lines.danish: Det lyder som en god idé. Jeg glæder mig til det!
lines.english: That sounds like a good idea. I'm looking forward to it!
